poem:
To Bella, Confined to a Tank

Through glass, the eyes meet,
A mirroring of hearts,
Bella, your silent song submerged
in unsought splendor.

Round and round, in Seoul's shine,
You trace the edges of an ocean misplaced— 
An opulent prison adorned in glass and steel.

Time races, Bella, 
in the heart of the city's hollow,
Yet, hope pulses in your every swirl.

For in the neon and noise,
Your call echoes— a cry of life, 
A plea for freedom.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Free Bella’: campaigners fight to save lonely beluga whale from Seoul mall In the heart of Seoul, amid the luxury shops at the foot of the world’s sixth-tallest skyscraper, a lone beluga whale named Bella swims aimlessly in a tiny, lifeless tank, where she has been trapped for a decade. Her plight is urgent, with campaigners racing to rescue her from the bare tank in a glitzy shopping centre in South Korea’s capital before it". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘Free Bella’: campaigners fight to save lonely beluga whale from Seoul mall In the heart of Seoul, amid the luxury shops at the foot of the world’s sixth-tallest skyscraper, a lone beluga whale named Bella swims aimlessly in a tiny, lifeless tank, where she has been trapped for a decade. Her plight is urgent, with campaigners racing to rescue her from the bare tank in a glitzy shopping centre in South Korea’s capital before it
